dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Attribute table for the region feature class of the GISCO NUTS 2010 dataset containing the names of the NUTS regions for the NUTS levels 0 to 3. The 'GISCO NUTS 2010' dataset represents the NUTS regions by means of region, arc and point topology. The NUTS geographical information is completed by attribute tables and a set of cartographic help lines to better visualise multipart polygonal regions.
The NUTS nomenclature is a hierarchical classification of statistical regions defined by Eurostat. The NUTS classification subdivides the EU economic territory into 3 statistical levels. The Regulation (EC) No 1059/2003 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the establishment of a common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS) was enforced the 11 July 2003. This regulation provided the NUTS classification with a legal background. Since then, 12 new countries joined the European Union. The NUTS regulation was officially enforced in these 12 countries the day of their accession to the EU. A non official NUTS-like classification has been defined for the EFTA countries, Croatia and Turkey. For further information about the NUTS classification please check the RAMON Eurostat site at http://ec.europa.eu/comm/eurostat/ramon/nuts/home_regions_en.html At present, six scale ranges (100K, 1M, 3M, 10M and 20M, 60M) are maintained in the GISCO geodatabase. The polygon and boundary classes delineate the regions while the points provide a label for each region. Associated tables contain basic information such as the region's name.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Data on administrative boundaries represent a fundamental element of almost any GIS. In the context of the GISCO information system, the NUTS boundaries data are a vital part of the geographic framework, providing means for registering data to regional territories. Equally, national and regional boundaries are essential components of the cartographic backdrop giving a recognisable geographic context to cartographic outputs.

Consts.useLimit: The datasets have been created for cartographic purposes.

dataLineage.statement:
This table was processed at Eurostat and does not involve any geometry processing.
2014-01-10: Errors in data delivery repaired and Saint Barth√©lemy also removed from NUTS level 0 (Country level) but remains in all other NUTS levels.

prcStep.description: The received input table NUTS_AT_2010 in MSAccess format (Eurostat) could be loaded directly into the empty table schema in ArcGIS through the simple dataloader in ArcCatalog.

dataSource.srcDesc: (i) NUTS nomenclature supplied by EUROSTAT - Regional Statistics.

DQConcConsis.measDesc: All feature classes, attribute tables and relationship classes should be present

ConResult.conExpl: All feature classes, attribute tables and relationship classes are present

DQDomConsis.measDesc: The integrity and cardinality of the relationships (conceptual and implemented) was checked by enforcing primary and foreign key integrity constraints in Oracle. The constraints referencing coded value domain tables were a test of domain consistency.

ConResult.conExpl: No errors occurred, so the integrity of all primary and foreign keys was confirmed. All the values of each coded value attribute are compliant to the domains (except for any NULL values). The cardinality can only be confirmed where it is strict enough for this test to detect errors.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef:
NUTS ReGion Identifier
This attribute contains the regional NUTS codes made up of 5,4,3 or 2 characters. As the NUTS code is hierarchical, the subsequent attributes, indicating level 0 to 2, are derived from the complete NUTS code by taking res. the first 2, 3 or 4 characters (this is the PK which can be used to relate to the NUTS label feature class and NUTS region feature class)
Country Code (2 character ISO-code for countries)
NUTS Region Name in native language
NUTS Region Name in native language converted to the Latin character set
NUTS Region Name in native language converted to ASCII-7 character set
NUTS Region Name in native language in HTML encoding

enttyp.enttypd: 1-1 relationship between NUTS_AT_2010 (NUTS_ID) and NUTS_RG_100K_2010 (NUTS_ID) to identify the name of the NUTS region for a specific label
1-1 relationship between NUTS_AT_2010 (NUTS_ID) and NUTS_LB_2010 (NUTS_ID) to identify the name of the NUTS region for a specific label
1-1 relationship between NUTS_AT_2010 (NUTS_ID) and NUTS_RG_03M_2010 (NUTS_ID) to identify the name of the NUTS region for a specific label
1-1 relationship between NUTS_AT_2010 (NUTS_ID) and NUTS_RG_10M_2010 (NUTS_ID) to identify the name of the NUTS region for a specific label
1-1 relationship between NUTS_AT_2010 (NUTS_ID) and NUTS_RG_01M_2010 (NUTS_ID) to identify the name of the NUTS region for a specific label
1-1 relationship between NUTS_AT_2010 (NUTS_ID) and NUTS_LB_2010 (NUTS_ID) to identify the name of the NUTS region for a specific label
1-1 relationship between NUTS_AT_2010 (NUTS_ID) and NUTS_RG_20M_2010 (NUTS_ID) to identify the name of the NUTS region for a specific label
